page.content: ripen off the crop.The pods turn brown and the seeds go black. The plant has few leaves, which are small, because the whole plant absorbs energy from the sun, not just the leaves as trees do. The combine harvests the crops and separates the seeds which are then crushed to extract the oil. The oil is then purified for its various uses. The remains of the plant are cut and used for animal fodder, the woody stems are preferably burnt to eliminate disease. The best growing area in the British Isles is reckoned to be between north of the Humber and south of the Scottish Border.
